actor_awards.notes: Born Louis Burton Lindley Jr., he was a real-life rodeo clown and cowboy before becoming an actor. He is best known for his iconic scene riding the bomb in 'Dr. Strangelove'. He was inducted into the Hall of Great Western Performers at the National Cowboy & Western Heritage Museum in 1982.

filmography.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
filmography.role_description: The patriotic B-52 bomber pilot who famously rides a nuclear bomb down to its target like a rodeo cowboy.
filmography.plot: An insane American general orders a bombing attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

filmography.title: Blazing Saddles
filmography.role_description: The dim-witted but loyal henchman to the villainous Hedley Lamarr, tasked with driving the townspeople of Rock Ridge away.
filmography.plot: In this satirical Western, a corrupt politician appoints a black sheriff to ruin a western town, but his bias becomes his undoing.

filmography.title: One-Eyed Jacks
filmography.role_description: A sadistic and corrupt deputy sheriff who takes pleasure in tormenting the protagonist.
filmography.plot: After being betrayed by his partner and spending five years in a Mexican prison, a bandit seeks revenge on his former friend who has become a sheriff.

filmography.title: Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
filmography.role_description: A courageous lawman who assists Pat Garrett and meets a poignant, memorable end by a river.
filmography.plot: An aging lawman is hired by wealthy cattle barons to hunt down his old friend, the outlaw Billy the Kid.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Most Promising Newcomer (Kris Kristofferson)

filmography.title: The Getaway
filmography.role_description: A deceptively friendly con man who helps the fleeing couple but has ulterior motives.
filmography.plot: A master bank robber and his wife race across Texas to the Mexican border with the police and his betrayal partners in hot pursuit.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Original Score

filmography.title: The Cowboys
filmography.role_description: A rustler and member of the gang that antagonizes John Wayne's character and his young crew.
filmography.plot: Rancher Wil Andersen is forced to hire inexperienced schoolboys as cowhands in order to get his herd to market on time.

filmography.title: Major Dundee
filmography.role_description: One of the rough-edged members of the ragtag force assembled to hunt Apaches in Mexico.
filmography.plot: A Union cavalry officer leads a contentious mix of troops, prisoners, and scouts into Mexico to hunt down Apaches.

filmography.title: In Harm's Way
filmography.role_description: A tough Chief Petty Officer serving in the Pacific theater of World War II.
filmography.plot: A naval officer reprimanded after Pearl Harbor is later promoted to rear admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.

filmography.title: The Ballad of Cable Hogue
filmography.role_description: A stagecoach driver and friend to the titular character in Sam Peckinpah's western.
filmography.plot: A hobo is accidentally left to die in the desert where he discovers a water spring, and transforms it into a profitable way-station.

filmography.title: Will Penny
filmography.role_description: A fellow cowhand and friend to the aging cowboy Will Penny.
filmography.plot: An aging cowboy on a cattle drive discovers a woman and her son living in his line shack and must protect them from a gang of raw-hiders.

filmography.role_description: A cracker-munching rustic who is captured by a Japanese submarine crew.
filmography.plot: Hysterical Californians prepare for a Japanese invasion in the days after Pearl Harbor.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Cinematography, Best Sound, Best Visual Effects

filmography.title: The Howling
filmography.role_description: The local lawman in a remote colony that turns out to be inhabited by werewolves.
filmography.plot: After a bizarre encounter with a serial killer, a television newswoman is sent to a remote mountain resort whose residents may not be what they seem.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Win – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: The Apple Dumpling Gang
filmography.role_description: A bumbling outlaw who, along with his partner, tries to steal a gold nugget from three orphans.
filmography.plot: Three bumbling outlaws find themselves saddled with three orphans who have struck gold.

filmography.title: Rancho Deluxe
filmography.role_description: An aging, wily stock detective hired to catch modern-day cattle rustlers.
filmography.plot: Two wealthy drifters plague a wealthy rancher by rustling his cattle, until the rancher hires a legendary stock detective to catch them.

filmography.title: White Line Fever
filmography.role_description: A trucking company employee caught between corporate corruption and his friendship with the hero.
filmography.plot: A young Air Force veteran borrows money to buy his own semi-truck, but discovers that the trucking business is run by organized crime.

filmography.title: Tom Horn
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic sheriff who has to deal with the legendary stock detective Tom Horn.
filmography.plot: A renowned former army scout is hired by ranchers to hunt down rustlers but finds himself a pawn in their political games.

filmography.title: Honeysuckle Rose
filmography.role_description: The loyal band member and bus driver for Willie Nelson's character.
filmography.plot: A country music star struggles to balance his life on the road with his wife and family back home.

filmography.title: The Sun Shines Bright
filmography.role_description: A lanky backwoodsman involved in the local politics of a small Kentucky town.
filmography.plot: A judge in post-Reconstruction Kentucky fights for reelection while dealing with a young woman's mysterious past and a near-lynching.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination - Grand Prize of the Festival

filmography.title: Savage Sam
filmography.role_description: A comical character in this Disney sequel to Old Yeller.
filmography.plot: Old Yeller's son, Savage Sam, helps Travis and Arliss Coates rescue their friends from Apaches.

filmography.title: The White Buffalo
filmography.role_description: A stagecoach driver who encounters Wild Bill Hickok.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok and Crazy Horse team up to hunt a legendary white buffalo.

filmography.title: The Flim-Flam Man
filmography.role_description: A local mark who gets swindled by the con artist Mordecai Jones.
filmography.plot: A veteran con man takes on a young apprentice, but their partnership is tested by the law and a local girl.

filmography.title: Rocky Mountain
filmography.role_description: A Confederate soldier on a mission in the West; often cited as Pickens' film debut.
filmography.plot: A Confederate troop patrol in the West tries to round up horses for the war effort but runs into Union soldiers and Native Americans.

filmography.title: A Thunder of Drums
filmography.role_description: A cavalry trooper stationed at a remote fort in Arizona.
filmography.plot: A gray-haired captain and a fresh-faced lieutenant clash over command styles and women at a cavalry outpost.

filmography.title: Stagecoach
filmography.role_description: The stagecoach driver in this remake of the 1939 classic.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers on a stagecoach traveling through Apache territory must confront their personal demons and outside threats.

filmography.title: Never Steal Anything Small
filmography.role_description: A dim-witted henchman to James Cagney's waterfront racketeer character.
filmography.plot: A waterfront labor leader tries to use the union treasury to get elected to public office.
